PC Gaming main theme!

Als Half Life 2 frisch erschienen ist, habe ich das Spiel in Verbindung mit einer neu gekaufen Grafikkarte erhalten. Leider konnte ich das Spiel damals aus irgendeinem Grund nicht zu ende spielen.
Jetzt hab ich es nochmal während der Rabatt-Tage günstig erstanden und muss sagen, dass das geniale Spielgefühl von damals sofort wieder da war. Die Grafik ist zwar nicht mehr die modernste - aber immernoch toll.
Letztendlich kommt es für mich am meisten darauf an, ob die Geschichte fesselt und das tut sie in jedem Fall!
Von mir eine absolute Empfehlung.

Fantastic Game, Half Life 1 did not live up for me, but this game is amazing and one of the best shooters, if not games in general I have ever played. The story is fantastic, gameplay is fun and guns feel good to use unlike in Half Life 1, the characters talking to you and not talking in some artificial cut scene is awesome. If you havent, buy this game and Ep 1 and 2

Played this one right after Black Mesa, this game was a really good addition to the first but it was not as exciting to me as Black Mesa was when i played it. It took me longer days and a bit longer of time to finish it but the ending was okay. Left off at a huge cliff hanger but i guess Episode 1 and 2 continue the story a bit. So i will be playing those but after i play another game. 8/10

Honestly I love half-life and when ever I play any half-life game I feel like the story actually matters instead of me not caring about the story and just skipping a cut scene but with half-life games they don't have the pointless cut scenes that just help ruin the immersion all scenes have you constantly in the characters vision. There's never really a boring moment in half-life 2, theirs always something to keep you entertain ether it be a intense fight or some cool science machine for you to play with. I always find my self constantly coming back to play half-life 2 when ever I'm bored or just needing something to play and it fills that need and its makes it fun to replay even when you have all the achievements and know everything that's gonna happen because you find some way to spice it up a bit like seeing if you can beat the game with out shooting and killing any npc.

Absolute classic, cant recommend enough.

1. [u]Graphics and story[/u] [i]10/10[/i] ([i]Half-Life 2[/i] is the continuation of the story of the mysterious character [u]Gordon Freeman[/u]. We could say in a general way that the story takes place after the events of [i]Black Mesa[/i]. We’ll not only contemplate the work on the graphics engine (a novelty at that time), but also the visual narration and the development of a story as a film. The game maintains the sci-fi narrative with a dose of survival and we’ll be an [i]anti-citizen[/i]. But different scenarios have been added to the game which often appear to be an «open world» game. All the characters continue to develop and unfold in each plot of the story. We’ll see a world in a utopia (landscapes between country and city with architecture from ex-soviet countries) with a high quality graphic work and excellent change of nuances. [u]Each object in the game plays an important role in the narration (as is the singularity), in addition to the lines of dialogue of the characters[/u]. The graphics engine has made it possible to give the characters a less artificial and robotic look, but without becoming something unpleasant. That same graphic engine has allowed an important novelty, our participation in the development of the story as if we were also the protagonists. We can see the scenes in what the developers call [i]real time[/i], that is, actions of the characters without having an awkward movie that can be skipped with enter. It’s a nice work-art!)

2. [u]Playability[/u] [i]10/10[/i] (Something that I liked about [i]Half-Life 2[/i] is the development of the player within the game. The controls begin with simple handling, until later the player will have challenges and difficulties proposed by the narrative plot. We could say that the more the player progresses, the more you learn to function within the dynamics of the game. [u]Something like this: a game with pedagogical instructions to overcome obstacles[/u]. The game begins with a teaching and later apply it in field practice. A simple teaching to a complex problem. [i]At all times of the game, there will always be premises about the problem and how the player can solve it[/i]. The rest consists only of developing and applying what has been learned. We can also interact with objects and with other characters, as many of them will be able to indicate the way to overcome the problem.)

3. [u]Music and FX[/u] [i]10/10[/i] (My surprise was to hear the soundtrack of [i]Half-Life 2[/i]. From the Valve Company I started with the game [i]Left 4 Dead 2[/i]. From that game the first thing I heard is Valve music. Music played as Barry shows the suit to Freeman. The soundtrack presented in the game offers a dynamic, narrative and immersive sound. The music has been well crafted with elements of electronic music and dark ambient. It bears a resemblance to the soundtracks of films, whose idea is to give the viewer an audio narration that accompanies the visual narrative symmetrically and whole. Each scenario has its own music. If we only listened to the music, we could possibly recognize the place in the game. Sometimes we’ll hear soft and mysterious music, other times music of tension and agitation. I think music is a subject that has been carefully into the game and all tracks will always be different.)

4. [u]Duration[/u] [i]9/10[/i] (The game has a considerable duration. All the scenarios that the player progresses will be different. I liked the contrast of the scenarios between country and city, between a closed world and an [b]open world[/b]. The ending has a classic sci-fi look. A place where all the problem of the game is concentrated. Everything seems an industrial look with an atmosphere of abandonment. Sometimes the player will be able to explore and other times remain in constant action. Depending on the difficulty of the game, it can be long or short-lived. A single player game. You can get the game in the famous [i]orange box[/i]!)

[h1]Recommendation: 10/10[/h1]

Without a doubt one of the greatest fps games I have ever played. IMO surpassed the original in every aspect, and even today, gameplay and level design still hold their own against modern AAA titles. The additions of weapons such as the gravity gun really made the game have a new twist to what the player can do, and new traps and enemies require you to learn how best to defeat them. For its time, Half Life 2 seems to have been ground breaking in the mechanics and what Valve achieved. 

Now with that said, there were some issues gameplay wise which frustrated me. The biggest concern with the Half Life series is that there are certain areas which punish you for having little to no health, with bullet sponge enemies that kill you and respawn over and over until you manage to figure out the perfect path to dodge bullets grenades and rockets. That is not fun. It is a chore to not die, rather than gameplay which should be about solving puzzles with a sense of urgency. My other gripe with this game was the terrible friendly AI, which often just got in your way in doorways or halls. At least they were able to kill things, but damn the AI really showed its age.
Потрясающая игра, особенно нравится интересный захватывающий сюжет, хорошая графика, разнообразие локаций, реалистичная физика игры.
It's Half Life. What else to add really.

Même si les premiers chapitres peuvent paraître lents au niveau de l'avancée (surtout si vous avez des nausées avec les FPS comme moi) ça monte crescendo et a son apogée vers le chapitre "anti-citoyen un".
- le gameplay est toujours bon, on a un FPS classique (les fps me donnent des nausées mais quand je n'en ai pas je prends mon pied sur ce jeu)
- l'ambiance horreur est toujours aussi bien réussie. on a des décors en extérieurs sombres, des endroits en huit-clos anxiogènes. Et de nouveaux aliens plus flippants que les crabes-têtes (oui c'est possible).
- le scénario est plus poussé que le 1 et un de mes préférés de tous les jeux auquels j'ai joué. Même si le début est plutôt lent en terme de trajet (surtout les chapitres avec l'hydroglisseur fps + eau + nausée = hmm hmm nan nan nan). C'est à partir du moment où on doit à aller à Nova Prospekt que les trajets sont meilleurs et plus intéressants. Et que ça commence à monter crescendo en tension jusqu'à son climax dans le chapitre anti-citoyen un jusqu'à la fin du jeu.
- les graphismes ne sont pas dérangeants personnellement je suis pas dur envers les jeux rétro par contre ça peut accentuer les nausées si vous avez déjà mal au ventre.
- au début on nous largue un peu en mode "voilà tiens démerde toi".

En gros, c'est un très bon jeu classé dans mes favoris. Très bon scénario et ambiance, le gameplay est classique c'est bien mais si vous avez des problèmes de nausées avec les FPS je vous conseille de jouer que quand vous avez le ventre vide :)).
